customData.content: 68-year-old man presented with neck lymphadenopathy. Medical history of endoscopic resection of a colon polyp 1 year previously. Smoked two packs of cigarettes per day for 48 years. Blood pressure was 148/91 mmHg and pulse rate was 111 bpm.

social_history.description: Smoked two packs of cigarettes per day for 48 years

customData.content: Edema from the neck to the right shoulder. Swelling of the right postauricular, cervical, and axillary lymph nodes.

Chest CT revealed a tumor in the right upper lobe with hypertrophy of the bronchovascular bundles. Lymphadenopathy at the hilar, mediastinal, supraclavicular, axillary, and cervical lymph nodes, predominantly on the right. Superior vena cava slightly compressed but patent. Right cervical lymph node biopsy and sputum cytology revealed lung squamous cell carcinoma (cT2aN3M1c; programmed death ligand 1 tumor proportion score, 10%).

imaging.type: Mass of right upper lobe of lung
imaging.impression: Tumor in the right upper lobe with hypertrophy of the bronchovascular bundles
Lymphadenopathy at the hilar, mediastinal, supraclavicular, axillary, and cervical lymph nodes, predominantly on the right
Superior vena cava slightly compressed but patent

customData.content: Cisplatin plus gemcitabine treatment for six cycles resulted in reduced size of primary lesion, but lymphedema progressed, and papules appeared in the anterior and lateral chest wall. FDG-PET/CT revealed scattered FDG uptake in the skin around the papules.

imaging.finding: FDG uptake in the skin around the papules
FDG uptake in the skin around the papules

customData.content: Skin biopsy indicated ZSM, judged as progressive disease. Pembrolizumab administered as second-line chemotherapy for two cycles; cancerous lymphangiopathy worsened and the patient died 7 months after initial presentation.

Autopsy and post-mortem biopsy of the skin and cervical lymph nodes indicated metastatic primary squamous cell lung carcinoma. Bilateral hilar lymph node metastasis, significantly larger on the right side. Lymphatic vessels near the subclavian vein and the lymphatic vessels inside the dermis near the papules were filled with tumor cells.

imaging.finding: Bilateral hilar lymph node metastasis, significantly larger on the right side

procedures.outcome: Metastatic primary squamous cell lung carcinoma

customData.content: FDG-PET/CT showed FDG uptake in skin metastasis, subclavicle and axillary lymph nodes. FDG uptake on the skin and subcutaneous tissue around papules at the level of the axilla and nipple. 18F-Fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG)-positron emission tomography (PET) window width on PET appears to be narrow to highlight the uptake in the subcutaneous tissue.

imaging.finding: FDG uptake in subclavicle lymph nodes
FDG uptake in axillary lymph nodes
FDG uptake on the skin and subcutaneous tissue around papules at the level of the axilla and nipple

data.content: Patient developed edema from the neck to the right shoulder and swelling of the right postauricular, cervical, and axillary lymph nodes.

Chest CT revealed a tumor in the right upper lobe with hypertrophy of the bronchovascular bundles and lymphadenopathy at the hilar, mediastinal, supraclavicular, axillary, and cervical lymph nodes, predominantly on the right. Superior vena cava slightly compressed but patent. Right cervical lymph node biopsy and sputum cytology revealed lung squamous cell carcinoma (cT2aN3M1c; programmed death ligand 1 tumor proportion score, 10%).

Patient was treated with Cisplatin plus gemcitabine for six cycles. The primary lesion size was reduced, but lymphedema progressed, and papules appeared in the anterior and lateral chest wall. FDG-PET/CT revealed scattered FDG uptake in the skin around the papules.

Skin biopsy indicated ZSM, judged as progressive disease. Pembrolizumab administered as second-line chemotherapy for two cycles; cancerous lymphangiopathy worsened and the patient died 7 months after initial presentation.

Autopsy and post-mortem biopsy of the skin and cervical lymph nodes indicated metastatic primary squamous cell lung carcinoma. Bilateral hilar lymph node metastasis, significantly larger on the right side. Lymphatic vessels near the subclavian vein and the lymphatic vessels inside the dermis near the papules were filled with tumor cells.

FDG-PET/CT showed FDG uptake in skin metastasis, subclavicle and axillary lymph nodes. FDG uptake on the skin and subcutaneous tissue around papules at the level of the axilla and nipple. 18F-Fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG)-positron emission tomography (PET) window width on PET appears to be narrow to highlight the uptake in the subcutaneous tissue.
